page.title: 01GENERAL INTRODUCTION PART 1
page.content: The grid area forms part of the{Lea {Valley}and straddles the River Lea(Lee) which runs from north to south towards London and the River Thames some 18miles south of the grid. { Urban development}is mainly to the west of the river and runs along the old A10 which was formerly the major trunk road between London, Cambridge and the north. The town of Hoddesdon is furthest north and runs south into Broxbourne and finally Wormley and Turnford. The main{lines of communication}all run north-south. The new A10 opened in 1974 skirts the west side of the grid and by passes all the major towns mentioned above. The main Cambridge-London railway line also runs north-south with a branch line to Ware and Herford.
